files.title: ABS
files.description: Return the absolute value of a number (removes negative sign)

files.title: ASC
files.description: Returns a numerical value that is the ASCII code of the first character of the string X$

files.title: ATN
files.description: Returns the arctangent of X in radians

files.title: CDBL
files.description: Converts X to a double-precision floating-point number

files.title: CHR$
files.description: Returns a one-character string whose ASCII code is the specified value

files.title: CINT
files.description: Converts X to an integer by rounding the fractional portion

files.title: COS
files.description: Returns the cosine of X in radians

files.title: CSNG
files.description: Converts X to a single-precision floating-point number

files.title: CVI, CVS, CVD
files.description: Convert string values to numeric values

files.title: EOF
files.description: Returns -1 (true) if the end of a sequential file has been reached

files.title: EXP
files.description: Returns e to the power of X

files.title: FIX
files.description: Returns the truncated integer part of X

files.title: FRE
files.description: Arguments to FRE are dummy arguments

files.title: HEX$
files.description: Returns a string which represents the hexadecimal value of the decimal argument

files.title: INKEY$
files.description: Returns either a one-character string cont~ining a character read from the terminal or a null string if no character is pending at the terminal

files.title: INP
files.description: Returns the byte read from port I

files.title: INPUT$
files.description: Returns a string of X characters, read from the terminal or from file number Y

files.title: INSTR
files.description: Searches for the first occurrence of string Y$ in X$ and returns the position at which the match is found

files.title: INT
files.description: Return the largest integer less than or equal to a number (floor function)

files.title: LEFT$
files.description: Return the leftmost N characters from a string

files.title: LEN
files.description: Returns the number of characters in X$

files.title: LOC
files.description: With random disk files, LOC returns the next record number to be used if a GET or PUT (without a record number) is executed

files.title: LOF
files.description: Returns the length of a file in bytes

files.title: LOG
files.description: Returns the natural logarithm of X

files.title: LPOS
files.description: Returns the current position of the line printer print head within the line printer buffer

files.title: MKI$, MKS$, MKD$
files.description: Convert numeric values to string values

files.title: OCT$
files.description: Returns a string which represents the octal value of the decimal argument

files.title: PEEK
files.description: Returns the byte (decimal integer in the range 0 to 255) read from memory location I

files.title: POS
files.description: Returns the current cursor position

files.title: RIGHT$
files.description: Return the rightmost N characters from a string

files.title: RND
files.description: Returns a random number between 0 and 1

files.title: SGN
files.description: NEEDS_DESCRIPTION

files.title: SIN
files.description: Returns the sine of X in radians

files.title: SPACE$
files.description: Returns a string of I spaces

files.title: SPACES
files.description: Returns a string of spaces of length X

files.title: SPC
files.description: Prints I blanks on the terminal

files.title: SQR
files.description: Returns the square root of X

files.title: STR$
files.description: Convert a number to its string representation

files.title: STRING$
files.description: Returns a string of length I whose characters all have ASCII code J or the first character of X$

files.title: TAB
files.description: Spaces to position I on the terminal

files.title: TAN
files.description: Returns the tangent of X in radians

files.title: USR
files.description: Calls the user's assembly language subroutine with the argument X

files.title: VAL
files.description: Returns the numerical value of string X$

files.title: VARPTR
files.description: Returns the memory address of a variable

files.title: AUTO
files.description: To generate a line number   automatically     after every carriage return

files.title: CALL
files.description: To call an assembly language subroutine

files.title: CHAIN
files.description: To call a program and pass variables to it            from the current program

files.title: CLEAR
files.description: To set all numeric variables to zero and all string variables to null; and, optionally, 'to set the end of memory and the amount of stack space

files.title: CLOAD THIS COMMAND IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE DEC VT180 VERSION
files.description: To load a program or an array from cassette tape into memory

files.title: CLOSE
files.description: To conclude I/O to a disk file

files.title: CLS
files.description: Clears the screen and moves the cursor to the home position

files.title: COMMON
files.description: To pass variables to a CHAINed program

files.title: CONT
files.description: To continue program execution after a Control-C has been typed, or a STOP or END statement has been executed

files.title: CSAVE THIS COMMAND IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE DEC VT180 VERSION
files.description: To save the program or an       array   currently     in memory on cassette tape

files.title: DATA
files.description: To store the numeric and string constants that are accessed by the program~s READ statement(s)

files.title: DEF FN
files.description: Define and name a user-defined function

files.title: DEFINT/SNG/DBL/STR
files.description: To declare variable types as integer,        single precision, double precision, or string

files.title: DELETE
files.description: To delete program lines

files.title: DIM
files.description: Declare array dimensions and allocate memory for array variables

files.title: EDIT
files.description: To enter Edit Mode at the specified line

files.title: END
files.description: To terminate program execution, close all   files and return to command level

files.title: ERASE
files.description: To eliminate arrays from a program

files.title: ERR AND ERL VARIABLES
files.description: NEEDS_DESCRIPTION

files.title: ERROR
files.description: 1) To simulate the occurrence of a BASIC-80 error1   or 2) to allow error codes to be defined by the user

files.title: FIELD
files.description: To allocate space for variables in a random file buffer

files.title: FILES
files.description: Displays the directory of files on disk

files.title: FOR ••• NEXT
files.description: Execute statements repeatedly with a loop counter

files.title: GET
files.description: To read a record from a random disk file into    a random buffer

files.title: GOSUB •.. RETURN
files.description: Branch to and return from a subroutine

files.title: GOTO
files.description: Branch unconditionally to a specified line number

files.title: HELP SET
files.description: Display help for a specific setting

files.title: IF ••• THEN[ ••• ELSE] AND IF ••• GOTO
files.description: Make decisions and control program flow based on conditional expressions

files.title: INPUT
files.description: Read user input from the terminal during program execution

files.title: INPUT#
files.description: To read data items from a sequential disk    file and assign them to program variables

files.title: ~ INPUTi
files.description: To read an entire line (up to 254 characters), without delimiters, from a sequential disk data file to a string variable

files.title: KILL
files.description: To delete a file from disk

files.title: LET
files.description: To assign     the   value   of   an   expression   to   a variable

files.title: LIMITS
files.description: Display resource usage and interpreter limits

files.title: LINE INPUT
files.description: To input an entire line (up to 254 characters) to   a string variable, without the use of delimiters

files.title: LIST
files.description: To list all or part of the program currently            in memory at the terminal

files.title: LLIST
files.description: To list all or part of the program currently     in memory at the line printer

files.title: LOAD
files.description: To load a file from disk into memory

files.title: LPRINT AND LPRINT USING
files.description: To print data at the line printer

files.title: LSET
files.description: Left-justifies a string in a field for random file output

files.title: MERGE
files.description: To merge a specified disk file into the      program currently in memory

files.title: MID$ Assignment
files.description: Replace characters within a string variable

files.title: NAME
files.description: To change the name of a disk file

files.title: NEW
files.description: To delete the program currently   in   memory   and clear all variables

files.title: NULL
files.description: To set the number of nulls to be printed at   the end of each line

files.title: ON ERROR GOTO
files.description: To enable error trapping and specify the   first line of the error handling subroutine

files.title: ON ••• GOSUB AND ON ••• GOTO
files.description: To branch to one of several specified line numbers, depending on the value returned when an expression is evaluated

files.title: OPEN
files.description: To allow I/O to a disk file

files.title: OPTION BASE
files.description: To declare      the     minimum   value   for   array subscripts

files.title: OUT
files.description: To send a byte to a machine output port

files.title: POKE
files.description: To write a byte into a memory location

files.title: PRINT
files.description: Output text and values to the screen

files.title: PRINTi AND PRINTi USING
files.description: To write data to a sequential disk file

files.title: PUT
files.description: To write a record from   a   random   buffer   to   a random

files.title: RANDOMIZE
files.description: To reseed the random number generator

files.title: READ
files.description: To read values from a DATA statement and assign them to variables

files.title: REM
files.description: To allow explanatory remarks to be inserted in a program

files.title: RENUM
files.description: Renumber program lines and update line references

files.title: RESET
files.description: Closes all open files

files.title: RESTORE
files.description: Resets the DATA pointer to the beginning or a specified line

files.title: RESUME
files.description: Continue program execution after error recovery

files.title: RSET
files.description: Right-justifies a string in a field for random file output

files.title: RUN
files.description: Executes the current program or loads and runs a program from disk

files.title: SAVE
files.description: To save a program file on disk

files.title: SET (setting)
files.description: Configure interpreter settings at runtime

files.title: SHOW SETTINGS
files.description: Display current interpreter settings

files.title: STOP
files.description: To terminate program      execution   and    return   to command level

files.title: SWAP
files.description: To exchange the values of two variables

files.title: SYSTEM
files.description: Exits MBASIC and returns to the operating system

files.title: TRON/TROFF
files.description: To trace the execution of program statements

files.title: WAIT
files.description: To suspend program execution while      monitoring the status of a machine input port

files.title: WHILE ••• WEND
files.description: Execute statements in a loop while a condition is true

files.title: WIDTH
files.description: To set the printed line width in number        of characters for the terminal or line printer

files.title: WRITE
files.description: To output data at the terminal

files.title: WRITE #
files.description: Write data to a sequential file with delimiters
